Name: ASurnameFull
Definition: That part of a name a person usually has in common with some other members of his/her family, as distinguished from his/her given names, as represented by text.

Name: ASurnameFirst
Definition: The person's identifying name within the family group or by which the person is socially identified, as represented by text.

Name: ASurnameSecond
Definition: That part of a name a person usually has in common with some other members of his/her family, as distinguished from his/her given names, as represented by text.

Name: ASurnameThird
Definition: That part of a name a person usually has in common with some other members of his/her family, as distinguished from his/her given names, as represented by text.

Name: AGivenNameFull
Definition: The person's identifying name within the family group or by which the person is socially identified, as represented by text.

Name: AGivenNameThird
Definition: The person's identifying name within the family group or by which the person is socially identified, as represented by text.

Name: AAddressFull
Definition: The address at which the client usually resides

Name: AAddressLocality
Definition: The name of the locality/suburb of the address, as represented by text.

Name: AAdressStateOrTerritory
Definition: The Australian state or territory where a person can be located, as represented by a code.

Name: BDiagnosisDate
Definition: The date on which the patient was first diagnosed with cancer (whether at its primary site or as a metastasis), expressed as DDMMYYYY.

Name: BDiagnosisDateValidityCode
Definition: TBD

Name: BPrimarySiteCode
Definition:
Person with cancer—primary site of cancer
The site in which the tumour originated in a person with cancer, as opposed to the secondary or metastatic sites, as represented by a code.

Name: BMorphologyCode
Definition:
Definitive Morphology at First Presentation
The histological classification of the cancer tissue (histopathological type) in a person with cancer, and a description of the course of development that a tumour is likely to take: benign or malignant (behaviour), as represented by a code.

Name: BBestDiagnosisBasisCode
Definition: The most valid basis of diagnosis in a person with cancer, as represented by a code.

Name: BSpreadDegreeCode
Definition: A measure of the progression/extent of cancer at diagnosis, as represented by a code.

Name: BLateralityCode
Definition: The side of a paired organ or the side of the body that is the origin of the primary cancer in a person with cancer, as represented by a code.

Name: BMelanomaThickness
Definition: The measured thickness of a melanoma in millimetres.

Name: BTumourSize
Definition: The largest dimension of a solid tumour, measured in millimetres.

Name: ADiagnosisAddressFull
Definition: The place the person usually resided in at the time of diagnosis

Name: BCaseClassCode
Definition: An indicator of the state/territory in which a person with cancer was diagnosed and treated.

Name: BPathologicalDiagnosisDate
Definition: The date on which a diagnosis of cancer was first confirmed by pathological investigation.

Name: BClinicalCancerSiteCode
Definition: TBD

Name: CEpisodeModalityCode
Definition: The type of treatment administered during the initial course of treatment for cancer, as represented by a code.

Name: CEpisodeIntentCode
Definition: The intention of the initial treatment for cancer for the particular patient, as represented by a code.

Name: CEpisodeStartDate
Definition: Date on which an admitted patient commences an episode of care.

Name: CEpisodeEndDate
Definition: Date on which an admitted patient completes an episode of care.

Name: CFacilityCode
Definition: An identifier for the establishment in which the episode or event occurred.

Name: CSpreadDegreeCode
Definition: A measure of the progression/extent of cancer at diagnosis, as represented by a code.

Name: CMDTDate
Definition: The date of first consultation with a multidisciplinary team of health professionals regarding the diagnosis, treatment and care of the person with cancer.

Name: CAdmitReasonCode
Definition: Episode of care - cancer treatment flag

Name: CPerformanceStatusCode
Definition:
"The result of the appraisal of the individual’s ability to manage activities of daily living, conducted at the time of diagnosis of cancer, as represented by a code.
"

Name: ABirthCountryCodeNotification
Definition: The country in which the person was born, as represented by a code.

Name: AIndigenousStatusCodeNotification
Definition: Whether a person identifies as being of Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander origin, as represented by a code. This is in accord with the first two of three components of the Commonwealth definition.

Name: ALanguagePreferenceCodeNotification
Definition: The language most preferred by the person for communication, as represented by a code.

Name: AAddressFullNotification
Definition: The address at which the client usually resides.

Name: AAddressLocalityNotification
Definition: The name of the locality/suburb of the address, as represented by text.

Name: AAddressPostcodeNotification
Definition: The postcode for the suburb of the patient's usual residential address.

Name: AAddressStateOrTerritoryNotification
Definition: The Australian state or territory where a person can be located, as represented by a code.

Name: AMedicareNumberNotification
Definition: Person identifier, allocated by the Health Insurance Commission to eligible persons under the Medicare scheme, that appears on a Medicare card.

Name: ADVANumberNotification
Definition: A unique personal identifier issued to a veteran by the Department of Veterans' Affairs.

Name: ACliinicalDetailsOptOutNotification
Definition: TBD

Name: ANotifyingFacilityCodeNotification
Definition:
"An identifier for the establishment in which the episode or event occurred.
"

Name: ADeathDateNotification
Definition: The date of death of the person.

Name: BDiagnosisDateNotification
Definition: The date on which the patient was first diagnosed with cancer (whether at its primary site or as a metastasis), expressed as DDMMYYYY.

Name: BDiagnosisDateValidityCodeNotification
Definition: The most valid basis of diagnosis in a person with cancer, as represented by a code.

Name: BPrimarySiteCodeNotification
Definition: The site in which the tumour originated in a person with cancer, as opposed to the secondary or metastatic sites, as represented by a code.

Name: BMorphologyCodeNotification
Definition: The histological classification of the cancer tissue (histopathological type) in a person with cancer, and a description of the course of development that a tumour is likely to take: benign or malignant (behaviour), as represented by a code.

Name: BLateralityCodeNotification
Definition: The side of a paired organ or the side of the body that is the origin of the primary cancer in a person with cancer, as represented by a code.

Name: BBestDiagnosisBasisCodeNotification
Definition: The most valid basis of diagnosis in a person with cancer, as represented by a code.

Name: BHistopathologicalGradeCodeNotification
Definition: The histopathological grade or differentiation in a person with cancer, as represented by a code.

Name: BHaematologicalCellTypeCodeNotification
Definition: The specific presentation of a lymphoid neoplasm, as represented by a code.

Name: BDiseaseGradeSchemeCodeNotification
Definition: The disease specific (histopathological) grading system used to record a specific measure of the aggressiveness of the cancer, as represented by a code.

Name: BDiseaseGradeScoreCodeNotification
Definition: The disease specific grade, score or measurement is calculated by the pathologist and reported according to the disease specific grading system being used, as represented by a code.

Name: BSpreadDegreeCodeNotification
Definition: A measure of the progression/extent of cancer at this episode of care, as represented by a code.

Name: BTNMStagingDateNotification
Definition: The date of TNM staging values for cancer.

Name: BTNMStagingTimingCodeNotification
Definition: An indictor of whether the staging was at diagnosis or not at diagnosis.

Name: BTStageCodeNotification
Definition: The size and extent of the primary tumour in a person with cancer, as represented by a code.

Name: BTStagingBasisCodeNotification
Definition: The evidence basis for the T stage value for a cancer, as represented by a code.

Name: BNStageCodeNotification
Definition: The absence or presence and extent of regional lymph node metastasis in a person with cancer, as represented by a code.

Name: BNStagingBasisCodeNotification
Definition: The evidence basis for the N stage value for a cancer, as represented by a code.

Name: BMStageCodeNotification
Definition: The absence or presence of distant metastasis in a person with cancer, as represented by a code.

Name: BMStagingBasisCodeNotification
Definition: The evidence basis for the M stage value for a cancer, as represented by a code.

Name: BTNMStageGroupCodeNotification
Definition: The anatomical extent of disease in a person with cancer based on the previously coded T, N and M stage categories, as represented by a code.

Name: BTNMEditionNumberCodeNotification
Definition: The edition number of the TNM staging scheme used to determine the extent or stage of the cancer, as represented by a code.

Name: BTNMStageBasisCodeNotification
Definition: The timing and evidence for cancer stage values, as represented by a code.

Name: BOtherStagingDateNotification
Definition: The date of non-TNM staging values for cancer.

Name: BOtherStagingSchemeCodeNotification
Definition: The reference which describes in detail the methods of staging and the definitions for the classification system used in determining the extent of cancer, as represented by a code.

Name: BOtherStagingGroupCodeNotification
Definition: The anatomical extent of disease in a person with cancer based on stage categories of a staging classification other than the standard TNM classification, as represented by a code.

Name: BOtherStagingVersionCodeNotification
Definition: The edition number or year of the cancer staging scheme used to determine the extent or stage of the cancer, as represented by a code.

Name: BOtherStagingBasisCodeNotification
Definition: The timing and evidence for cancer stage values, as represented by a code.

Name: CEpisodeWorkflowStatusNotification
Definition: Status of completion of episode information in the NSWCR for this treatment.

Name: BRecurrenceDateNotification
Definition: The date on which a patient is diagnosed with the first recurrence of a cancer, expressed as DDMMYYYY.

Name: BRecurrenceDateFlagNotification
Definition: An indicator of the accuracy of the components of a reported date, as represented by a code.

Name: BRecurrenceSiteNotification
Definition: The site of first recurrence of cancer in a person with cancer, after a disease-free period, as represented by a code. ICD-03 or ICD-10 Code

Name: BRecurrenceTypeNotification
Definition: The type of first recurrence of primary cancer after a disease free intermission or remission, as represented by a code.

Name: BBestRecurrenceBasisNotification
Definition: The most valid basis of diagnosis of the first recurrence of a cancer or distant metastasis in a person with cancer, as represented by a code.

Name: AMRNNotification
Definition: A patient identifier assigned by and unique to a hospital or health service provider.

Name: APatientAreaUniqueIdentifierNotification
Definition: A unique code assigned to the patient for identification at the former Area Health Service level.

Name: CTreatmentModalityNofication
Definition: The type of treatment administered during the initial course of treatment for cancer, as represented by a code.

Name: CTreatmentIntentNotification
Definition: The intention of the initial treatment for cancer for the particular patient, as represented by a code.

Name: CNoTreatmentReasonNotification
Definition: The primary reason why no active cancer treatment is specified within a Cancer Care Plan, as represented by a code.

Name: CInititalTreatmentFlagNotification
Definition: An indicator of whether treatment for cancer was administered during the initial course of treatment, or following the initial course due to disease progression and recurrence, as represented by a code.

Name: DAMOAPRARegistrationNumberNotification
Definition: The Registration number of the doctor treating the patient for this episode of care.

Name: DTreatingDoctorsNameNotification
Definition: The full name of the doctor in charge of the case.

Name: BCancerSpecialistReferalDateNotification
Definition: The date that a person with cancer was referred to a cancer specialist (oncologist, haematologist or surgeon).

Name: BCancerSpecialistConsultationDateNotification
Definition: The date of the first consultation between a person with cancer and the cancer specialist (oncologist, haematologist or surgeon) during this course of treatment.

Name: CEpisodeGroupNotification
Definition: The type of treatment administered during this episode of treatment for cancer, as represented by a code.

Name: CEpisodeStartDateNotification
Definition: Date on which an admitted patient commences an episode of care.

Name: CTreatmentEndDateNotification
Definition: Date on which an admitted patient completes an episode of care.

Name: CPrincipleAdmissionReasonNotification
Definition: TBD

Name: CSeparationStatusNotification
Definition: The indication of whether the person was alive or dead at the time the patient last received active treatment, or obtained a pathology test, for a notifiable cancer.

Name: CProcedureCodeNotification
Definition: The surgical procedure(s) for the initial management of the cancer. ICD-10-AM procedure code

Name: CSurgicalDateNotification
Definition: The date on which a cancer-directed surgical procedure was performed during the initial course of treatment for cancer, expressed as DDMMYYYY.

Name: CPrincipleProcedureFlagNotification
Definition: Indicates the main procedure the person with cancer was admitted for.

Name: CCancerProcedureFlagNotification
Definition: Indicates that the procedure code is cancer-related

Name: CSystemicTherapyEpisodeStartDateNotification
Definition: The start date of systemic agent therapy administered during the initial course of treatment for cancer, expressed as DDMMYYYY.

Name: CSystemicTherapyEpisodeEndDateNotification
Definition: The completion date of systemic agent therapy  administered during the initial course of treatment for cancer, expressed as DDMMYYYY.

Name: CSystemicTherapyTypeNotification
Definition: The type of systemic agent therapy  administered during the course of treatment for cancer, as represented by a code.

Name: CUniqueProtocolIdentifierNotification
Definition: The eviQ protocol identifier for the systemic therapy agent protocol administered during the initial course of treatment for cancer.

Name: CSystemicTherapyCyclesCountNotification
Definition: The number of treatment cycles that an agent was administered in the course of treatment.

Name: CProtocolModifiedNotification
Definition: The eviQ protocol identifier for the systemic therapy agent protocol administered during the initial course of treatment for cancer.

Name: CProtocolConsentNotification
Definition: An indicator that a patient consented to the treatment protocol

Name: CDrugCodeNotification
Definition: An indicator that a patient consented to the treatment protocol

Name: CDoseCodeNotification
Definition: The quantity of a particular systemic therapy agent prescription administered, taken or absorbed at one time.

Name: CRouteCodeNotification
Definition: The mode of introduction of a particular systemic therapy agent into the body of a person with cancer, as represented by a code.

Name: CRegimenStartDateNotification
Definition: The mode of introduction of a particular systemic therapy agent into the body of a person with cancer, as represented by a code.

Name: CRegimenEndDateNotification
Definition: The date the chemotherapy regimen ended

Name: CRegimenFrequencyNotification
Definition: The frequency with which a particular systemic therapy agent was administered, during the course of treatment for a cancer, as represented by a number

Name: CRegimenFrequencyUnitNotification
Definition: The unit of measure used to express the frequency with which a particular systemic therapy agent was administered, during the course of treatment for a cancer, as represented by a code.

Name: CRegimenDayNotification
Definition: The day of the systemic therapy treatment cycle on which a particular dose was administered.

Name: CCareReadyDateNotification
Definition: The date on which a cancer specialist (oncologist, haematologist or surgeon) indicated treatment of a person with cancer should commence.

Name: CRadiotherapyEpisodeStartDateNotification
Definition: The start date of the radiotherapy course administered during the initial course of treatment for cancer, expressed as DDMMYYYY.
Accepted values: DDMMYYYY. If Unknown set to '01/01/9999' except for Inpatient.

Name: CRadiotherapyEpisodeEndDateNotification
Definition: The completion date of the radiotherapy administered during the initial course of treatment for cancer, expressed as DDMMYYYY.

Name: CRadiotherapyTreatmentTypeCodeNotification
Definition: The type of radiation therapy used in the primary treatment of the cancer, as represented by a code.

Name: CRadiotherapyPriorityCodeNotification
Definition: The priority code of the Radiotherapy Course.

Name: CRadiotherapyTotalDose
Definition: The total received dose of radiation delivered at initial treatment measured in the Radiation Dose Unit specified.

Name: CRadiationDoseUnitClassificationCodeNotification
Definition: The classification used to measure the radiation dose.

Name: CRadiotherapyTotalFractionsNotification
Definition: Total number of radiotherapy fractions delivered in the initial course of radiation.
Accepted values:
" Total dose, beam type and number of fractions describe the course of radiotherapy.

 
00 - No radiation fractions were received
NN - Number of Fractions received
98 - Not applicable
99 - Radiation therapy was administered but the dose is unknown 
 "

Name: CRadiotherapySiteCodeNotification
Definition: The target site of radiotherapy administered during the initial course of treatment for cancer, as represented by a code.

Name: CRadiotherapySiteStartDateNotification
Definition: The start date of the radiotherapy administered to the radiotherapy site during the initial course of treatment for cancer, expressed as DDMMYYYY.

Name: CRadiotherapySiteEndDateNotification
Definition: The completion date of the radiotherapy administered to the radiotherapy site during the initial course of treatment for cancer, expressed as DDMMYYYY.

Name: CActualRadiationDose
Definition: The received dose of radiation delivered to the Radiotherapy Site measured in the Radiation Dose Unit.

Name: CActualRadiationFractionsNotification
Definition: Number of radiotherapy fractions delivered to the Radiotherapy Site.
Accepted values:
" Total dose, beam type and number of fractions describe the course of radiotherapy.

 
00 - No radiation fractions were received
NN - Number of Fractions received
98 - Not applicable
99 - Radiation therapy was administered but the dose is unknown 
 "

Name: GClinicalTrialNameNotification
Definition: The name of the clinical trial indicates which clinical trial the patient is enrolled in.

Name: GClinicalTrialEnrolmentDateNotification
Definition: The date a person with cancer was enrolled in a clinical trial.

Name: DMTDConsultationDateNotification
Definition: The date of first consultation with a multidisciplinary team of health professionals regarding the diagnosis, treatment and care of the person with cancer.

Name: BPalliativeCareReferralDateNotification
Definition:
The date a person with cancer was referred to a palliative care physician or team during their course of treatment.
"

Name: CPerformanceStatusDateNotification
Definition:
The date on which the appraisal of the individual’s ability to manage activities of daily living was conducted.
"

Name: CPerformanceStatusCodeNotification
Definition:
"The result of the appraisal of the individual’s ability to manage activities of daily living, conducted at the time of diagnosis of cancer, as represented by a code.
"

Name: CPyshocialReferralNotification
Definition:
"
The health professional, support group or advisor to whom a person with cancer is initially referred for psycho-social support or intervention, as represented by a code.
"
Accepted values:
"Four values can be recorded. The order of referral should be: 

first referral=psychosocial referral 1
second referral= psychosocial referral 2 
third referral= psychosocial referral 3
fourth referral= psychosocial referral 4"

Name: BBDSEInitialPresentationNotification
Definition: Description of the principal method by which the cancer was detected at initial presentation.

Name: BBDSEInvasiveTumourSizeNotification
Definition: The maximum diameter in millimetres of the furthest points of extension of the tumour cells.

Name: BBDSESurgicalMarginInvolvmentNotification
Definition: The extent of carcinoma in the surgical resection margin, in millimetres.

Name: BBDSEClosestSurgicalMarginDistanceNotification
Definition:
"The distance of the closest surgical margin from the invasive or in situ
carcinoma in millimetres (mm)."

Name: BBDSESentinelLymphNodesCountNotification
Definition: The total number of a person's sentinel lymph nodes examined by the pathologist.

Name: BBDSEPostiveSentinelLymphNodesCountNotification
Definition: The total number of sentinel lymph nodes reported as containing tumour after examination by a pathologist.

Name: BBDSELymphovascularInvasionNotification
Definition: The presence or absence of the invasion of cancer cells into blood vessel(s) and/or the lymphatic system, as represented by a code.

Name: BBDSERegionalLymphNodesExaminedCountNotification
Definition: The total number of regional lymph nodes examined by a pathologist in a person with cancer.

Name: BBDSEPostiveRegionalLymphNotesCountNotification
Definition: The total number of regional lymph nodes reported to contain tumour in a person with cancer.

Name: BBDSEMenopausalStatusNotification
Definition: The menopausal status of a person with cancer.
Accepted values:
"1 Pre-menopausal: An individual who has not yet experienced the menopause
2 Post-menopausal: An individual who has experienced the menopause and the occurrence of 12 months of spontaneous amenorrhoea
3 Peri-menopausal: An individual who is either in the period just prior to menopause or the subsequent 12 months of amenorrhea following menopause
4 Male - not female
9 Unknown: The patient's menopausal status is not known"

Name: BBDSEOestogenReceptorStatusNotification
Definition: The result of oestrogen receptor assay at the time of diagnosis of the primary breast tumour, as represented by a code.

Name: BBDSEProgesteroneReceptorStatusNotification
Definition: The results of progesterone receptor assay at the time or diagnosis of the primary breast tumour, as represented by a code.

Name: BBDSEHER2StatusNotification
Definition:
"The result of a person's human epidermal growth factor receptor-2 (HER2) test, as
represented by a code."

Name: BBDSEHER2TestTypeNotification
Definition: The type of test used to determine the results of human epidermal growth factor receptor-2 (HER2) at the time of diagnosis of the primary tumour, as represented by a code.

Name: BBDSEInvasiveTumoursCountNotification
Definition: The number of invasive tumours in one breast, as represented by a code.

Name: BBDSETotalLesionExtentNotification
Definition: The maximum diameter in millimetres of the furthest points of extension of the whole lesion including DCIS which extends beyond the invasive component

Name: BBDSENecrosisNotification
Definition: Person with cancer - necrosis of in-situ breast tumour
Accepted values:
"1 No necrosis/minimal - Necrosis not present or minimal
No central duct necrosis is present, but focal necrosis and isolated apoptotic cells may be present.
2 Necrosis - Necrosis present
Central necrosis is identified in ducts (this has previously been described as “comedo” type necrosis).
9 Not applicable - The default value for this data item. It is not applicable if the tumour is invasive"

Name: BBDSEAccomodationTypeNotification
Definition: Accommodation chargeable status elected by patient on admission.

Name: BCDSEInitialPresentationNotification
Definition: The presentation of the patient who has been admitted for a scheduled appointment/ surgery/ screening for bowel cancer, as represented by a code.
Accepted values:
"1 Screening detected, method of screening not otherwise specified
2 Faecal Occult Blood Test for screening bowel cancer
3 Patient presented with symptoms of bowel cancer
9 It is unknown how the patient presented"

Name: BCDSEEmergencySurgeryReasonNotification
Definition: The reason that emergency surgery was performed for colorectal cancer, as represented by a code.

Name: BCDSESurgeryMethodNotification
Definition: The method of surgery performed, as represented by a code.

Name: BCDSEStomaTypeNotification
Definition: The type of stoma created for a patient with colorectal cancer, as represented by a code.

Name: BCDSETumourSizeNotification
Definition: The largest dimension of a solid tumour, measured in millimetres.

Name: BCDSERegionalLymphNodesExaminedCountNotification
Definition: The total number of regional lymph nodes examined by a pathologist in a person with cancer.

Name: BCDSEPostiveRegionalLymphNodesCountNotification
Definition: The total number of regional lymph nodes reported to contain tumour in a person with cancer.

Name: BCDSELymphovascularInvasionNotification
Definition: The presence or absence of the invasion of cancer cells into blood vessel(s) and/or the lymphatic system, as represented by a code.

Name: BCDSEPerineuralInvasionNotification
Definition: An indication of whether perineural invasion was present , as represented by a code

Name: BCDSEMismatchRepairDeficiencyStatusNotification
Definition: The result of Mismatch Repair Enzyme Testing, as represented by a code.

Name: BCDSEClosestSurgicalMarginDistanceNotification
Definition: The distance of carcinoma from the surgical resection margin, in millimetres.

Name: BCDSEResidualTumourStatusNotification
Definition: A code set describing whether residual tumour is present or absent after the initial course of treatment for cancer.

Name: BCDSEPostOperativeComplicationsNotification
Definition: The type of complication following surgery for colorectal cancer, as represented by a code.

Name: BCDSEReadmissionWithin28DaysNotification
Definition:
"An indication of whether the patient was readmitted as an admitted patient within 28 days of last being admitted and, if so, whether the admission was to the facility reporting the current episode, or another facility, as represented by a code.
"

Name: BCDSEReadmissionReasonNotification
Definition: The reason that a patient was readmitted to hospital following treatment for colorectal cancer.

Name: BCDSERectalCancerLevelNotification
Definition: The level of rectal cancer in relation to the anal verge, as represented by a code.
Accepted values:
"1 High: entirely above the level of the peritoneal reflection anteriorly (11-15cm)

2 Medium: astride (or at) the level  of the peritoneal reflection anteriorly (6-10cm)

3 Low: entirely below the level of the peritoneal reflection anteriorly (0-5cm)"

Name: BCDSEAnalVergeDistanceNotification
Definition: The distal level of rectal cancer from the anal verge, measured in centimetres (cm).

Name: BCDSERadialResectionMarginNotification
Definition: The distance from the tumour to the radial resection margin, measured in millimetres (mm).

Name: BPDSEDiagnosisPSANotification
Definition: Person with cancer - PSA score

Name: BPDSEProstateRiskStratificationNotification
Definition: Person with cancer - prostate risk stratification
Accepted values:
"1 – Low Risk
2 – Intermediate Risk
3 – High Risk       
9 – Unknown Risk
"

Name: BPDSERadicalProstatectomyNotification
Definition: Person with cancer - Gleason grade at radical prostatectomy

Name: BMDSEMelanomaUlcerationNotification
Definition: Person with cancer - ulceration of melanoma
